entry.title: Distance Field Raymarcher
entry.content:
Description

This is an implementation of a raymarcher in processing.js. I’m using it here to render 3-dimensional fractals defined by distance field functions. Depending on the speed of your computer, this may take a while to render.

entry.title: Life
entry.content:
Description

This is Conway’s Game of Life in processing.js.

The left mouse button toggles cells. The right mouse button starts the simulation. The middle mouse button clears the grid.

entry.title: Spirosketch
entry.content:
Description

Spirosketch is like drawing with 30 colored pencils at the same time. The way it works is that there are around 30 colored particles “orbiting” your mouse – kind of like planets orbiting the sun. The trails they make can be quite interesting.

Tools Used

  • Processing.js

entry.title: Mandelbrot Set
entry.content:
Description

A visualization of the Mandelbrot set written with processing.js.

Left mouse button zooms in; right mouse button zooms out; middle mouse button resets the zoom. Spacebar doubles iteration count (to increase detail).

entry.title: Langton's Ant
entry.content:
Description

Langtonâ€™s Ant is a 4-state two-dimensional Turing machine invented in the 1980s. The ant starts out on a grid containing black and white cells, and then proceeds according to the following set of rules:

  1. If the ant is on a black square, it turns right 90 degrees and moves forward one unit.
  2. If the ant is on a white square, it turns left 90 degrees and moves forward one unit.
  3. When the ant leaves a square, it inverts the color.

Tools Used

  • Processing.js
